description: The main village of Drum Island, where most of the island's remaining population resides. It serves as the central settlement after King Wapol's abandonment. Dalton acts as the de facto leader and protector of this community.

keyEvents.title: Straw Hats Arrive at Bighorn
keyEvents.description: The Straw Hat Pirates are escorted to Bighorn village by Dalton after gaining the trust of the island's inhabitants.
keyEvents.significance: Establishes Bighorn as the base of operations during the Drum Island arc.

keyEvents.title: Revelation of Drum Island's History
keyEvents.description: In Bighorn, Dalton reveals the tragic history of Drum Island to Vivi and Usopp, explaining King Wapol's tyranny.
keyEvents.significance: Provides crucial context for understanding the island's current state.

keyEvents.title: First Mention of Blackbeard
keyEvents.description: Dalton reveals in Bighorn that the Blackbeard Pirates attacked Drum Island five months ago.
keyEvents.significance: Historic moment - first mention of Blackbeard in the anime.

description: The former royal palace of Drum Kingdom, located atop the tallest peak of the Drum Rockies. After King Wapol abandoned the island, Dr. Kureha took residence in the castle. It stands as a symbol of both the island's former glory and Wapol's cowardice.

keyEvents.title: Introduction to Drum Castle
keyEvents.description: Dalton explains that Drum Castle sits atop the tallest mountain and is now home to Dr. Kureha, the island's only remaining doctor.
keyEvents.significance: Sets up the main objective for the arc - reaching Drum Castle to save Nami.

keyEvents.title: Dr. Kureha at Drum Castle
keyEvents.description: Dr. Kureha is shown in silhouette at Drum Castle, awaiting the arrival of those who seek medical help.
keyEvents.significance: Visual introduction to the location where much of the arc's climax will take place.

statusHistory.reason: Now inhabited by Dr. Kureha after Wapol's abandonment

description: A series of tall, cylindrical mountains that dominate Drum Island's landscape. The mountains are covered in snow and ice, making them treacherous to climb. The tallest peak houses Drum Castle. The Drum Rockies are inhabited by dangerous creatures called Lapahns.

keyEvents.title: Introduction to the Drum Rockies
keyEvents.description: Dalton explains that the Drum Rockies are a series of tall mountains, with Drum Castle sitting atop the tallest peak.
keyEvents.significance: Establishes the physical challenge that Luffy and Sanji must overcome to save Nami.

keyEvents.title: Luffy's Decision to Climb
keyEvents.description: Luffy decides to climb the Drum Rockies while carrying Nami on his back, despite the extreme danger.
keyEvents.significance: Sets up one of the arc's most iconic moments.

keyEvents.title: Warning About the Lapahns
keyEvents.description: Dalton warns Luffy and Sanji about the Lapahns that inhabit the main route up the Drum Rockies.
keyEvents.significance: Foreshadows the dangers awaiting them on their climb.

statusHistory.reason: Natural mountain range on Drum Island

description: A winter island in the Grand Line known for its perpetual snow and distinctive cylindrical mountains (Drum Rockies). Once a prosperous medical nation under the Drum Kingdom, it fell into ruin after King Wapol's tyrannical rule and subsequent abandonment during the Blackbeard Pirates' attack.

keyEvents.title: Drum Island's Tragic History Revealed
keyEvents.description: Dalton explains how Drum Island was once a prosperous medical nation before Wapol's tyranny destroyed it.
keyEvents.significance: Provides crucial backstory for understanding the island's current state and sets up the arc's themes.

keyEvents.title: Blackbeard Pirates' Attack
keyEvents.description: Dalton reveals that the Blackbeard Pirates attacked Drum Island five months ago, causing Wapol to flee with all the doctors.
keyEvents.significance: Establishes the island's recent traumatic history and introduces Blackbeard to the series.

statusHistory.reason: Island is inhabited and functioning despite hardships
